does: A hairstyle with a strong angular front and adding height will help to elongate the face
Avoid over softening this already round shape and avoid creating more width on sides. This will accentuate the shape further
It's best to leave your hair down and avoid tucking it behind your ears
The main trick of this hairstyle is the long strands in the front, falling below the chin line. They should be straight (if necessary, you can pull them out with a flat iron)
donts: No straight parting in the center (if there is a parting, then oblique and from the side)
No slicked-back hair - it should fall in front of the face

short: bob with long strands in the front straight hair
medium: chin-length bob with bangs straight hair

does: A hairstyle that creates width through the jawline with fullness and width through the nape to balance the shape of the face
Try wearing hair forward around the face
Soft angles in the front that start below the face help balance out the forehead
The key is to keep bangs narrow so that you can create the illusion of less width at the top
donts: Try to avoid styles that accentuate the width of the forehead or cheekbones

short: pixie bob with side-swept chin-length bangs
medium: wavy shags with soft side-swept bangs

does: Hairstyles that are fuller at the sides and that soften the corners are best
Add height on top and narrow sides
donts: Avoid enhancing the jawline further with blunt lines
Avoid volume at the widest part of your face
Strong fringe is not recommended either

short: pixie bob with side-swept chin-length bangs

does: Choose styles that will enhance your key features
With their balanced proportions and versatile nature, oval faces have the advantage of being able to pull off a wide range of hairstyles with ease.
donts: Steer clear of too much height on top since that can make this shape feel oblong
The ultra-short length of micro bangs can disrupt the balanced proportions that characterise oval faces, potentially creating too harsh of a contrast
Very long, straight hair tends not to be very flattering for oval faces. The length of the hair can elongate the face shape, creating a potential imbalance

medium: wavy shags with soft side-swept bangs

does: Creating fullness through the sides and keeping volume from the ears up is key
Soften the edges and strong jawlines with layers, volume, and side-swept or feathered fringe
Long layers and angles add movement and texture to the hair
donts: Flat, straight hair with no movement and volume with no width should be avoided
Avoid having your hair too long. The longer the hair, the more it will lengthen your face more than it already is
